List Views

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the functionality of List View panels

* Create a new List View

¢ Create and modify row iterator, row and cell
widgets

¢ Reference a List View from a parent container

| List View Panels G&G

66 :.

¢ AList View Panel is a container widget that allows the user to view information
about multiple objects at the same time

¢ Often referred to as "List View“

¢ Incertain cases, users can also edit the data displayed in the List View

| Typical List View Panel structure G

+ List View Panel typically takes single root object that has an array of

ABContact as root object entities to p s

+ Row Iterator processes the related array and produces a row for each
NA ContactNotes array entity instance

<i Row contains one or more Cell widgets

Sw

Cell displays an individual field of an entity

| Row Iterator G&G

« An Iterator is a widget that takes a set of items and performs the same set of
actions for each member

« ARow lterator takes a set of objects (array or query results) and renders each
object as one row of cells

| Row iterator: no objects processed G

¢ Row Iterator has 4 required properties:
« value: anABContact.HistoryEntries — the set of elements to process
* valueType: HistoryEntry[] — the type of the set of elements
« elementName: currentHistoryEntry — points to the object in the array associated with the row
+ editable: false — whether the cells can be edited or not

| inline widget vs. PCF file G
— ListViewPCrFile List ViewWidget

¢ Differences: ¢ Differences:

« Reusable ¢ Not reusable

* Takes a root object ¢ Inherits parent root object

* Created as separate PCF file and * Created as a List View widget in the
filename ends with LV parent container’s PCF file

¢ Similarities: ¢ Similarities:

« It can exercise control over all elements * It can exercise control over all elements

If the container is likely to be needed in multiple places, create a reusable PCF file

| Inline widget vs. PCF file example G

ABContactHistoryScreen.pcf ABContactHistoryScreen.pcf

anABContact : ABContact anABContact : ABContact

PanelRef

ABContactHistoryLV.pcf

anABContact : ABContact

Row Iterator Row Iterator

| ListViewinput vs. PanelRef

ABContactHistoryDV.pcf

ABContactHistoryScreen.pcf

anABContact : ABContact anABContact : ABContact

List View Input Panel Ref

ABContactHistoryLV.pcf ABContactHistoryLV.pcf

anABContact : ABContact

anABContact : ABContact

Row Iterator Row Iterator

Cells

| Toolbar and pagination

¢ A toolbar is a horizontal bar containing buttons and other useful widgets

¢ Itcan be directly added to a Screen, Panel Ref or List View Input

¢ Every List View Panel must have an associated toolbar

* If needed, the application automatically displays buttons to support pagination

| Demonstration G

Creating a new List View

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Review Questions

Question

_- — InaList View:
4

Oo A) What type of widget displays individual fields of data?

B) What type of widget organizes the individual fields of data?

~SS S e e H

Answer

,- — InaList View:

¢
oY A) What type of widget displays individual fields of data?

B) What type of widget organizes the individual fields of data?

A) Cell widgets

B) Rowwidgets

-SS SS e  e e H

Question G

_-— — Assume you have a list view panel with "anABContact" as the root
Y object. The list view panel displays the contact’s addresses.
7

A) What would the row iterator's "value" property be set to?
B) What would the row iterator's "element name" be set to?
C) What other widgets would make use of the element name?

~SS S e e H

Answer G

_— — Assume you have a list view panel with "anABContact" as the root
Y object. The list view panel displays the contact’s addresses.
4

A
B

C) What other widgets would make use of the element name?

What would the row iterator's "value" property be set to?
What would the row iterator's "element name" be set to?

A) anABContact.Addresses (assuming that the name of the addresses array is
"Addresses")

B) The value is arbitrary, but it would probably be set to something like
"currentAddress".

Cc) The cell widgets inside the row iterator's row. For example, a cell displaying the
street would have a value of "currentAddress. Street".

-SS SS e  e e H

Question G

_— — Allist view typically needs a toolbar, even if it is read-only. Why?
¢

¢
7

~SS S e e H

Answer G

_— — Alist view typically needs a toolbar, even if it is read-only. Why?
¢
o” The toolbar is needed for the paging controls. These controls are used to view each

page of rows if the number of rows is greater than what can be displayed at one time.

-SS SS e  e e H

Question G

_- — Inwhat way is embedding a List View Panel in a detail view panel
¢ different from embedding a list view panel in a screen?

¢
7

~SS S e e H

Answer

_- — Inwhat way is embedding a List View Panel in a detail view panel
Y different from embedding a list view panel in a screen?
4
To embed a list view panel in a detail view panel , use a List View Input widget. To
embed a list view panel in a screen (or card view panel or List Detail Panel , you use a

Panel Ref widget.

-SS SS e  e e H

Lesson

objectives ¢ Describe the functionality of List View panels
* Create a new List View

review ¢ Create and modify Row Iterator, Row and Cell

widgets
¢ Reference a List View from a parent container

| Student exercise
